metadata.name: El Vuelo (The Flight)
metadata.description:
Welcome to "Ethereal Echos," a collection that speaks to the heart of rebirth, steeped in the traditions of Dadaism and imbued with the aesthetics of Baroque figurative art.

As a young boy, I experienced the profound loss of my beloved grandmother, an event that instigated my journey from Mexico to the States. Years later, I stood by my wife's side as we mourned the passing of her father shortly after our wedding. These moments of loss and upheaval have left indelible marks on my life and have shaped the way I view the world.

"Ethereal Echos" is an embodiment of this worldview, a testament to the enduring belief in the cycle of life and death and the promise of rebirth. The collection is more than an exploration of the Dada and Baroque styles; it's a deeply personal narrative about resilience and hope in the face of loss expressed in a vibrant colorful way.

Every artwork in this collection is a symbol of resurgence, a tribute to those we've loved and lost, and a celebration of the new lives they may be living. This is my testament to the enduring cycle of existence, a reminder that from every end springs a new beginning.
